body.p: The Board analysed the effects on preparers of financial statements of replacing the reference to the Framework in paragraph 11(b) of IAS 8 and discussed the results of the analysis at the November 2016 Board meeting (see November 2016 AP10G Effects of the proposed changes to the Conceptual Framework on preparers). The analysis suggested that the scope of any changes to preparers’ accounting policies is likely to be limited because:

li.p: most preparers of financial statements do not develop accounting policies by reference to the Framework because most transactions are:
accounted for by applying accounting policies developed using other sources referred to in paragraphs 11–12 of IAS 8; or

exempt from the requirement to apply paragraph 11 of IAS 8; for example, IFRS 6 Exploration for and Evaluation of Mineral Resources exempts entities from applying paragraph 11 of IAS 8 to the recognition and measurement of exploration and evaluation assets; and

in most of the few remaining areas, application of the revised concepts in the 2018 Conceptual Framework would be expected to result in similar accounting outcomes to application of the concepts in the Framework.
